tutorial.speak:
Welcome to the Advanced Search tutorial in B1.church Admin. This guide will show you how to use advanced search features to find specific people in your database.
To access advanced search, navigate to the People section in your B1.church Admin dashboard.
Click on the Advanced Search button next to the search bar.
The advanced search interface allows you to create complex search queries using multiple criteria.
Start by selecting a field to search, such as name, email, phone number, or any custom field.
Choose an operator for your search, such as equals, contains, or greater than.
Enter the value you're searching for in the value field.
You can add multiple conditions to your search by clicking Add Condition.
Choose whether the conditions should match all criteria or any criteria.
You can also search within specific groups or by membership status.
Once you've set up your search criteria, click Search to see the results.
The results will show all people who match your search criteria.
You can save your search for future use by clicking Save Search.
Saved searches can be accessed from the Saved Searches dropdown.
You can also export the search results to a CSV file for further analysis.
